results.title: Computers and you
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description: In this film a computer display terminal and diagrams are used to explain, in simple terms, how a computer works and what it can do. A clear, visual explanation of how “bits” of information are given and instructions, flow charts, and information storage methods are explained. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level students.

results.title: Computers
results.creator_credit: Bailey Film Productions and Victor and Ellen Landweber
results.brief_description: Describes the major components of a modern digital computer, and explores how the binary number system is useful in computer technology. The computer makes very rapid computations, and stores vast quantities of information.

results.title: Computer: tool for the future
results.creator_credit: Sidney Platt, National Geographic Society and Yves Gerard Issembert
results.brief_description: A look at the history of tools such as the abacus, adding machines and computers, the recent developments in computer technology and how computers are used to manage information and various applications of computers today. Also mentions some of the concerns that computerization raises.

results.title: Composition and function of blood (TEFC)
results.brief_description: What is concealed in a drop of human blood? What is the role of the blood? This film attempts to provide a detailed illustration of typical properties of human blood, with the aid of animal tests and valuable electron microscopic photographs.

results.title: Composition
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Discusses composition as one of the basic elements of design and illustrates the function of good design, both in the world of art and in industry and everyday life

results.title: Compliance, self control and prosocial behavior
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: enhancing social and cognitive growth in children.”.
The socialisation process is important if children are to be raised into healthy adults. Skills and traits children must learn are co-operation, sharing, empathy, self-control, the delay of gratification and empathy which can be enhanced through play. Styles of parenting are discussed together with the technique of modeling to develop positive behaviour and the effect of self-fulfilling prophecies.

results.title: Compilation: one hundred entertainments
results.brief_description: One hundred entertainments: Follows an acrobatic troupe in Shensi Province as they perform and talk about their lives. “Son of the ocean”: A film crew travels on a boat on the Yangtze and talks to some of the passengers.

results.title: Compilation: not so much a desert more a way of life
results.brief_description: Not so much a desert more a way of life: Much of Australia is described as desert, but wherever he looks, David Bellamy finds life among the sand and rocks. “The Great barriers” (prod. Mike Weatherley): Australia’s coasts are battleground’s where seaweeds, coral and mangroves fight for survival against the ravages of the ocean.

results.title: Compilation: il bruco the apple worm
results.brief_description: Three animated films by Bruno Bozzetto. “The Apple worm”: A humorous look at the troubles of an apple worm. “The Swimming pool”: A man who looks forward to using his new swimming pool is thwarted at every turn. “Self service”: A satirical cartoon about a group of enterprising mosquitoes.
